intro: Paepalanthus elongatus var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are narrow and strap-like. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
